Gesty lets you create personal, hand drawn gestures that act as shortcuts to the functions you use the most on your phone. You can create simple gestures for your contacts, apps and websites that let you access them quickly and easily. \n\nTap the Intro button for a guided tour of how to use Gesty.

Gesty lets you create personal, hand drawn gestures that act as shortcuts to the functions you use the most on your phone. You can create simple gestures for your contacts, apps and websites that let you access them quickly and easily. \n\nTap the Intro button for a guided tour of how to use Gesty.
To create and assign a new gesture, tap the \‚Add new gesture\’ button on your gestures overview page.
Next, tap on the category you want to assign a gesture to. You can assign gestures to apps, actions, contacts and websites.

When prompted, draw the gesture you want to assign to this app, action, contact or website. It can be any shape you like, but the simpler the better. You can try as many times as you want, and when you\’re done just tap the \‚Save\’ button.
To add the Gesty widget to your homescreen, long-press your Android phone\’s homescreen and select it from the list.

To use Gesty, just tap the widget on your homescreen and draw the gesture for the app, action, contact or website you want. If Gesty doesn\’t recognise the gesture you\’ve drawn, try again or tap on the \‚Saved gestures\’ button to see and edit your existing gestures.
You can customise your gesty app by choosing the colour and accuracy of your gestures.

Gesty lets you create personal, hand drawn gestures that act as shortcuts to the functions you use the most on your phone. You can create gestures for contacts, apps and websites.

Here a gesture is a figure or shape that you can draw with your finger on the Gesty homescreen to access your favourite functions. Gestures can be one or two letters, numbers, abstract characters or something else simple to draw and easy to remember.

Once you\’ve added the Gesty widget to your Android homescreen, you can launch it with a single tap. Once launched you\’ll be prompted to draw the gesture for the function you want, or you can access your saved gestures list where you can create new and edit existing gestures. For a practical demo, take the tour by tapping the \‘Intro\’ button on the Gesty welcome page.
How many gestures can I save?
You can save as many gestures as you can remember and recreate.
Can I have more than one character in a gesture?
Yes, but the more complicated you make a gesture, the harder it is to recreate accurately so we suggest keeping them simple.
To edit and delete a gesture, go to your saved gestures list, tap on the gesture you want to edit and then tap the \‘Edit\’ or \‘Delete\’ button.
I can’t remember how I drew a gesture, what should I do?

To see how you drew a gesture, go to your saved gestures list, tap on the gesture in question and watch the animation of how you drew it. All your gestures must be recreated in the same way you originally drew them.
Why don’t some of my gestures work?

If a gesture doesn’t work, it isn’t being recognised accurately enough. To adjust accuracy recognition, tap on the settings icon in the top right of your screen and slide the accuracy bar towards ‘Less accurate’. Generally, we recommend keeping the accuracy bar centred to ensure the best recognition rate. The best way to ensure your gestures are always recognised is to keep them simple and make sure no two are too similar.
